# 1. Loading the dataset 

```{r load-data, message=FALSE}
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(knitr)
library(tidyr)

# Check if dataset exists
if (!file.exists("raw_data/hiv-behavior_national_zaf.csv")) {
  stop("Dataset not found. Please check the file path: raw_data/hiv-behavior_national_zaf.csv")
}

# Load dataset
hiv_behaviorDataset <- read_csv("raw_data/hiv-behavior_national_zaf.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
head(hiv_behaviorDataset)

```

# 4. Visualizations

```{r}
library(ggplot2)

dir.create("../outputs/visuals", recursive = TRUE, showWarnings = FALSE)

# Create a pie chart showing the distribution of HIV status by gender
lit_dist <- hiv_behaviorDataset %>%
  filter(Indicator %in% c(
    "Women who have HIV",
    "Women who may have HIV",
    "Women who dont have HIV",
    "Men who have HIV",
    "Men who may have HIV",
    "Men who dont have HIV"
  )) %>%
  mutate(Value = as.numeric(Value),
         Gender = ifelse(grepl("^Women", Indicator), "Women", "Men"),
         Category = gsub("Women who |Men who ", "", Indicator))

ggplot(lit_dist, aes(x = "", y = Value, fill = Category)) +
  geom_col(width = 1) +
  coord_polar("y") +
  facet_wrap(~Gender) +
  labs(title = "HIV Status Distribution by Gender in South Africa (2016)") +
  theme_void()
ggsave("../outputs/visuals/hiv-behaviorByGender.png", width = 6, height = 4)


```
```{r}
# Keep only % indicators (exclude totals and counts)
lit_data <- hiv_behaviorDataset %>%
  filter(IndicatorType == "I") %>%
  mutate(Value = as.numeric(Value),
         Gender = ifelse(grepl("^Women", Indicator), "Women", "Men"))

ggplot(lit_data, aes(x = Indicator, y = Value, fill = Gender)) +
  geom_col(position = "dodge") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    title = "hiv-behavior and Education Indicators (South Africa, 2016)",
    x = "Indicator",
    y = "Percentage"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
ggsave("../outputs/visuals/hiv-behaviorEducationBarPLot.png", width = 6, height = 4)


```

# 5. Summary Tables

```{r}
dir.create("../outputs/visuals", recursive = TRUE, showWarnings = FALSE)
dir.create("../outputs/summary tables", recursive = TRUE, showWarnings = FALSE)
dir.create("../outputs/dictionary", recursive = TRUE, showWarnings = FALSE)

# 1. Remove first row if it's metadata/header
numeric_cols <- c("Value", "DenominatorWeighted", "DenominatorUnweighted", "CILow", "CIHigh")  mutate(across(all_of(numeric_cols), ~ as.numeric(.), .names = "cleaned_{col}"))

hiv_behavior_clean <- hiv_behaviorDataset[-1, ] %>%
  mutate(across(all_of(numeric_cols), ~ as.numeric(.), .names = "cleaned_{col}"))
numeric_cols <- c("Value", "DenominatorWeighted", "DenominatorUnweighted", "CILow", "CIHigh")# 2. Convert relevant numeric columns to numeric

hiv_behavior_clean <- hiv_behavior_clean %>%
  mutate(across(all_of(numeric_cols), ~ as.numeric(.)))

# 3. Create a tidy summary table
summary_table <- hiv_behavior_clean %>%
  summarise(across(all_of(numeric_cols),
                   list(mean = ~mean(., na.rm = TRUE),
                        sd   = ~sd(., na.rm = TRUE),
                        min  = ~min(., na.rm = TRUE),
                        max  = ~max(., na.rm = TRUE)))) %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = everything(),
    names_to = c("Variable", "Statistic"),
    names_sep = "_",
    values_to = "Value"
  ) %>%
  arrange(Variable)

# Save summary table
write_csv(summary_table, "../outputs/summary tables/summary_hiv-behavior.csv")

# Display
kable(summary_table, caption = "Summary Statistics for Key Numeric Variables in the hiv-behavior Dataset")
```
